kmail.ui.inbox

Class InboxWindow

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • kmail.ui.inbox.InboxWindow
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class InboxWindow
extends javax.swing.JFrame
    A JFrame that shows the emails in the user's inbox and the body of the email. All features of the program are either directly accessible in this window, or the feature can be accessed by navigating from this window.
    Author:
    Kelsey McKenna
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • InboxWindow

        public InboxWindow(KMailClient handler,
                   Credentials auth)
            throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Create the frame and add event handlers.
        Parameters:
        handler - the object that launched this inbox window
        auth - the credentials (username and password) for the email account.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

        private void addFilter(Filter filter)
        Add the specified filter to the list of filters, and write it to file
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to be added

      • refreshInbox

        private void refreshInbox()
                   throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Refresh the emails in the inbox, and apply the filters/flags to any new emails. Also reset the text in the search field.
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

      • filterInbox

        private void filterInbox(java.lang.String keyword)
                  throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Filter the inbox to include only those emails that contain the specified keyword.
        Parameters:
        keyword - the search term
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

      • refreshMessageStrip

        private void refreshMessageStrip(int i)
                          throws javax.mail.MessagingException
        Refresh the strip for the specified message. This may be called when the seen status of a message has changed, or when its flag has been changed etc.
        Parameters:
        i - the index of the message
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException

                            throws javax.mail.MessagingException,

        Show the content of the specified message in the txtMessageContent text pane.
        Parameters:
        index - the index of the message
        Throws:
        javax.mail.MessagingException
